edu.gcu.cst341.service

Class DataService

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gcu.cst341.service.DataService

  • public class DataService
extends java.lang.Object
    Class contains SQL CRUD functions for the banking application

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataService()
      No-argument constructor for class: Opens a MySQL database and creates a Statement object

      • dbRetrieveCustomerByUsername

        public int dbRetrieveCustomerByUsername(java.lang.String usernameToCheck)
        Attempts to return a customer id from the credentials table where the username is the usernameToCheck to validate the username does not already exist for a new customer or to validate login credentials for an existing customer
        Parameters:
        usernameToCheck - the username to check for existence
        Returns:
        the customerId if a record exits with usernameToCheck or 0 if not

                            java.lang.String firstName,
                            java.lang.String email,
                            java.lang.String phone)
        Adds a customer to the customers table
        Parameters:
        lastName - the contact name being added
        firstName - the contact phone being added
        email - the customer's email
        phone - the cutomer's phone number
        Returns:
        the customerId of the created customer if successful; -1 if unsuccessful

        accountNumber - the account number to insert into the table

        the number of records inserted into the table (1 if successful, 0 if not)

      • dbRetrieveCustomerByLoginCredentials

        public int dbRetrieveCustomerByLoginCredentials(java.lang.String username,
                                                java.lang.String hashedSalt,
                                                java.lang.String hashedPassword)
        Queries the database for unique username and hashed password combination UNUSED FOR VALIDATING LOGIN CREENTIALS BECAUSE hashedSalt is UNIQUE TO THE CUSTOMER AND ONLY STORED IN THE DATABASE, THUS IS UNKNOWN AT LOGIN TIME
        Parameters:
        username - the customer's username
        hashedSalt - the hashed password salt
        hashedPassword - the hashed password
        Returns:
        the customer id corresponding to the username and password record

      • dbUpdateAccountBalances

        public <E> int dbUpdateAccountBalances(int customerId,
                                       E account)
        Updates account balance and writes a transaction to the database
        Type Parameters:
        E - an Account object (Checking, Saving, or Loan)
        Parameters:
        customerId - The customerId being updated
        account - The Account object being updated (Checking, Saving, Loan)
        Returns:
        number of records inserted (1 if successful, 0 if not)

      • dbDeleteCustomerById

        public int dbDeleteCustomerById(int customerId)
        Deletes a record from the customers table which will work only if all other child tables (credentials, customer_accounts, and customer transactions are first deleted)
        Parameters:
        customerId - the id of the customer to delete
        Returns:
        the number of records deleted (1 if successful, 0 if not)
